detaileddescription.para: enum that defines calibration status of gravity
data type for gravity g data
Defines the handle for gravity object. This handle is required for the initialisation of gravity
custom data types for gravity data data type for gravity lsb data
data type for gravity m/s2 data

simplesect.para: This API needs to be called when we require to stop the gravity data reading.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next Byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to #BCDS_getUserErrorCode() API to know the user type return code present in #BCDS_SensorErrorType.h.

parameterdescription.para: the handle to the gravity object that should be initialized
In case of invalid sensor handle.
If called without initializing the sensor.

simplesect.para: This API needs to be called before calling any other function of the gravity sensor.
Refer #XdkSensorHandle.h for selecting the proper handle.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next Byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to #BCDS_getUserErrorCode() API to know the user type return code present in #BCDS_SensorErrorType.h.

parameterdescription.para: output parameter in which the gravity data will be written to, from within the function
If called without initializing the sensor.
In case gravityData is NULL pointer.

simplesect.para: The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next Byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to #BCDS_getUserErrorCode() API to know the user type return code present in #BCDS_SensorErrorType.h.

parameterdescription.para: output parameter in which the gravity data will be written to, from within the function
If called without initializing the sensor.
In case gravityData is NULL pointer.

simplesect.para: The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next Byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to #BCDS_getUserErrorCode() API to know the user type return code present in #BCDS_SensorErrorType.h.

parameterdescription.para: output parameter in which the gravity data will be written to, from within the function
If called without initializing the sensor.
In case gravityData is NULL pointer.

simplesect.para: The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next Byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to #BCDS_getUserErrorCode() API to know the user type return code present in #BCDS_SensorErrorType.h.
